meanings.definition: To tear or pull out forcibly
meanings.sent1: She was evulsing the weeds from the garden with determination.
meanings.sent2: The dentist had to evulse the decayed tooth to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was a game to evulse the pages from the book.
meanings.sent4: The storm evulsed the trees from the ground, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The detective evulsed the crucial evidence from the suspect's alibi.

meanings.definition: The act of tearing or pulling out forcibly
meanings.sent1: The evulsing of the bandage caused a sharp pain in his arm.
meanings.sent2: The evulsing of the weeds revealed a patch of fresh soil underneath.
meanings.sent3: The evulsing of the curtain during the play made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The evulsing of the old wallpaper exposed the original paint color of the room.
meanings.sent5: The evulsing of the nail from the wall left a small hole behind.
